title: Wrestlers End Protest, But Fight for Justice Continues: Indian Athletes Shift Focus to Court After Chargesheet Filed Against Brij Bhushan
content:
India's top wrestlers, including Olympic medalists Sakshi Malik, Bajrang Punia, and Vinesh Phogat, have ended their months-long protest against former Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, shifting their focus to seeking justice through the courts.

The decision comes after the Delhi Police filed a chargesheet against Singh, who is also a Bharatiya Janata Party MP, for alleged sexual harassment of female wrestlers.  While the wrestlers acknowledge the chargesheet as a step towards accountability, they remain determined to pursue their fight for justice until all allegations are addressed. 

This development highlights the ongoing struggle for safety and fairness within Indian wrestling, with athletes demanding a complete overhaul of the federation and a culture of accountability.
